flawed_nl_solution:
The truck driver drives for 10 hours at 30 miles per hour, so she drives 10*30=<<10*30=3000>>3000 miles.
Therefore, she needs 3000/10=<<3000/10=300.0>>300.0 gallons of gas.
This will cost her 300.0*$2=$<<300.0*2=600.0>>600.0.
She will make 3000*$0.5= $<<3000*0.5=1500.0>>1500.0.
Thus, after paying for gas, she will make $1500.0-$600.0=$<<1500.0-600.0=900.0>>900.0.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
